qas.question: During what part of the week is the time change most often scheduled?
What do we avoid disrupting by doing the time shift during days most people don't work?

context: Clock shifts are usually scheduled near a <a0_0>weekend<a0_0/> midnight to lessen disruption to <a1_0>weekday schedules<a1_0/>. A one-hour shift is customary, but Australia's Lord Howe Island uses a half-hour shift. Twenty-minute and two-hour shifts have been used in the past.
